results.title: How to make a movie
results.brief_description: Although short and largely created to practise the Straford Brothers’ unique approach to editing and transitions, this already shows their ambitions for scene and story. Here, a frustrated filmmaker tries to make a ‘classic.’

results.title: Darren's day out
results.brief_description:
A journey through Darren’s colorful Koori paintings of Gippsland. His images depict his visit to Metung rocks, Kalimna and an Emu Farm, and through text, Darren conveys his thoughts and impressions of his day out.
No dialogue only baclground sound effects.
Created as part of the “Bute Utes the Movie” project in association with Regional Arts Victoria.

results.title: Thirty years destroyed
results.brief_description: In this scripted drama, a mad scientist realises his life’s work - with deathly consequences. Borrows from classic horror movies of the period to irresistable effect.

results.title: We used to call them Blackboys
results.creator_credit: Goulburn Ovens Institute of TAFE and Maz McGann
results.brief_description: Using photographic images, this story of the grass trees growing on the ranges outside Wangaratta becomes a poetic meditation on how a person’s ideas on place can change with understanding and compassion. European insensitivity and ignorance of the past has been replaced with political awareness and correctness, a sense of the land and the environment and a desire for reconciliation with those who belonged to the land before the invasion of the white man. A sensitive and thought-provoking piece. Made as part of Regional Arts Victoria’s Bute Utes - the Movie program.

results.title: Annual leave 1952
results.brief_description: The first filmed road trip to Eildon and Taggerty in their 1935 ‘Standard 10’ car shows the start of works on Lake Eildon to raise the level of storage.

results.title: Selection of titles from the Inala Straford Home Movie Archive Collection
results.brief_description: Diverse productions made by brothers Frank and John Straford in their Brighton Backyard between 1951 and 1956. Without formal training and using the most basic of equipment and self invented production techniques, the brothers produced an irresistible array of short animations, scripted dramas and home movies that have a freshness and charm 50 years later.

results.title: World to conquer
results.brief_description: This sci-fi ‘Straford Brothers Specialite’ is a scripted drama featuring local student actors. A classic sci-fi set up, it has some nifty DIY special effects including painstakingly made miniature sets (watch out for the alien control room!), animated spaceship and a alien periscope very reminiscent of early ‘Doctor Who’ episodes.

results.title: My grandfather's country
results.creator_credit: Lisa Roberts, Edie Terrick, Poogie Hayes and Elaine Terrick
results.brief_description:
Elaine Terrick’s mum, Edie Terrick, takes a journey back to the place she calls her grandfather’s country - in the mountainous ranges of Gippsland, Victoria. A place where her grandfather survived the slaughtering of his aboriginal people and where he as an abandoned child was found by white people - the O’Rourke family - taken in and brought up as an O’Rourke. For Edie it is an emotional but rewarding journey. Contains beautiful images of the high country and of the “place” where Edi’s grandfather grew up.
Created as part of the “Bute Utes the Movie” project in association with Regional Arts Victoria.

results.title: Victim
results.creator_credit: Basil Dearden, Michael Relph and Parkway Films
results.brief_description: Dirk Bogarde stars as Melville Farr, a successful lawyer in this film which caused a sensation at its original release. Farr is approached by police who are looking into the theft of money they suspect is being used as payment for blackmail by Jack Barrett (Peter McEnery). Farr initially denies knowing about Barrett because of their previous homosexual relations. Barrett eventually chooses suicide over disclosing the affair and Farr guiltily takes a personal interest in locating the blackmailer. He discovers that Barrett was not the only one being blackmailed, and Barrett must decide between exposing his homosexuality and threatening his career or challenging the legal system that decreed homosexuality a criminal offence and bringing Barrett’s blackmailers to justice. Screenplay by Janet Green and John McCormick. Cast also includes Sylvia Syms, Dennis Price, Anthony Nicholls and Peter McEnery.

results.title: Boppo's bike ride
results.creator_credit: South West Institute of TAFE, Allan Parker, Yaraan Bundle and Ivan Couzens
results.brief_description:
A grandfather/grandaughter collaboration, this is one man’s journey through place and time from the 1930s-1960s. Ivan Couzens reminisces about the days when riding a bike was the only way to get around; school was a five mile ride away; and when he started work at the Bluestone quarries, the bicycle was his only mode of transport. A light-hearted look at the past interspersed with photographs and images of places once travelled. Music: “Greenflower” by Rob Bundle.
Created as part of the “Bute Utes the Movie” project in association with Regional Arts Victoria.
